li.a: Outstanding Vocational Student of the Year

div.div: The South Shore Regional School District, through its vocational technical high school and adult education program, serves as the leading educational institution and community resource for all citizens who seek to explore, develop and enhance career and technical skills and experiences.

Together they have produced 1300 face shields for our Health Care Workers and First Responders. Lisa Bellantoni, Paul Bello and Jerry Shaw continue to work day in and day out manufacturing and supplying these much needed face shields to area facilities. They do all this along with working to educate our students remotely! We all have heroes and these three are the heroes of SST! From all us to you, THANK YOU for what you are doing.

a.title: Share this post in your email

div.div:
Good evening,
We wanted to remind everyone that our Remote Learning School begins week 2 at 10:00 am tomorrow morning. Freshmen and Juniors will be in academics while sophomores and seniors will move to shop and related. You will find copies of this week's schedule and an agenda page to help students stay on track with deadlines in your school email.
As always students should fill out the attendance survey to start their day. On Monday, you will hear a personal message from Mr. Aubrey.
Finally, The Department of Education has allowed and our own School Committee has voted to not have April Vacation this year. We have chosen to do this to keep momentum going for our Remote Learning School. Therefore, B cycle academic, shop and related classes will run Tuesday through Friday next week. This change will move the last day of school to Friday, June 12th. We will share a new school calendar with you later in the week.
As always stay safe, stay mentally engaged and be physically active.
The Leadership Team

a.title: Share this post in your email

div.div:
Hello SST families,
The South Shore Leadership Team would first off like to thank you for your continued support our school, including its temporary Remote Learning School we are currently employing.
Please visit your email attached to the school for information on tonight's' webinar.
Sincerely,
thickey@ssvotech.org Tom Hickey, Superintendent
maubrey@ssvotech.org Mark Aubrey, Principal
sbaldner@ssvotech.org Sandy Baldner, Asst. Principal
Kberry@ssvotech.org Katie Berry, Director of Spec. Education
kboyle@ssvotech.org Keith Boyle, Vocational Coord. and Co-op
bmello@ssvotech.org Bob Mello, Vocational Programs and Dean of Students
cpaluzzi@ssvotech.org Crystal Paluzzi, IT Director

div.a: SST Staff Message to our students

a.title: Share this post in your email

div.div:
Good morning,
Parents and students are asked to check your school email for an attachment for this week's Remote Learning School class schedule.
Please remember that staff will be available at school from 11:00 am to 1:00 pm to hand out Chromebooks as needed. No appointment necessary.
